meanings.definition: A person who delivers a long, passionate speech or lecture.
meanings.sent1: The haranguer captivated the audience with his fiery speech.
meanings.sent2: The political haranguer spoke for hours about his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The haranguer at the town hall meeting had everyone nodding off.
meanings.sent4: The street preacher was a haranguer of souls, trying to save them from damnation.
meanings.sent5: The passionate haranguer left a lasting impression on all who listened.

meanings.definition: To deliver a long, passionate speech or lecture.
meanings.sent1: She would often haranguer her friends about the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent2: The candidate harangued the crowd with promises of change.
meanings.sent3: The teacher harangued the students into paying attention with funny anecdotes.
meanings.sent4: The coach harangued the team, pushing them to give their best on the field.
meanings.sent5: The CEO harangued the employees to meet the quarterly targets.
